txt.en: Ôk-weni-Dhûr is in Drû Bhûta.\n\nYou should speak with Ôk-weni-Dhûr.
Ôk-weni-Dhûr, a seemingly friendly Wose, wants you to laugh for the local inhabitants of Drû Bhûta.
Show the Woses of Drû Bhûta your <rgb=#FF0000>laugh</rgb> ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
The Wose blinks a couple times
The Wose looks up at the sky
Ghâr-buri-Bhâm scratches his arm
Dhûn-buri-Ghôb winds up some twine and stares at you
Khûr-pulo-Skâl just keeps whittling
Woses can be found in Drû Bhûta.\n\nYou should show off you laugh to the Woses.
Gnô-buri-Krûg stretches then shifts his weight
Ôk-weni-Dhûr is in Drû Bhûta.\n\nYou should speak with Ôk-weni-Dhûr.
In unison, a deep, guttural laugh echoes along the cliffs. The mighty sound is joyous!
Speak with Ôk-weni-Dhûr
Speak with Ôk-weni-Dhûr
Listen to the laugh of the Woses

You tell the Wose that no one laughed or even reacted to your best laughs.\n\n'Drúedain honest. Your laugh not great.  Drúedain have real laugh. We never hear bad laugh before. You gave us great gift with bad laugh you have. You have heart. Now we give you gift. Here is great laugh of the Drúedain.'
Ôk-weni-Dhûr is in Drû Bhûta.\n\nYou should listen to the laugh of the Woses.
The Roar of the Woses
You acknowledge that the Drúedain indeed have the greatest laugh in all of Middle-earth.\n\n'We like you, friend. You bring joy to Drû Bhûta.'
'Us Drúedain never hear [placeholder] laugh before. Show us.'\n\nYou are uncertain but assume it is some sort of  Drúedain tradition of acceptance.
